Some growth scans take an hour or more. I have one every 6 weeks because I failed my quad screen & even though everything has looked ok since then they want to monitor baby's growth. With me they measure every major bone & all organs & they take between 45 minutes & 1 hour & 15 minutes depending on how much baby wants to cooperate. In a normal pregnancy they do one at 20 weeks to measure everything & that's they only one you get until delivery.

I think pictures depend on the doctor. With my last they didn't give pics unless it was the 20 week ultrasound unless you ask for 1 or 2. This time they give them to me everytime without asking.

I had one done yesterday, first one ever. They just measured her head, a leg bone & her belly. It took 20 min or less, & they told me her estimated weight & what percentile that was in. I don't think they would've give me pics if I didn't ask...& I asked if they could try the 3D ones (I really didn't wanna pay to get them done) & I left with a disc of 5 3d pics of my baby! Never hurts to ask!
